text: does loving yourself feel impossible
sometimes if self-love feels like the
hardest thing to do and you don't even
know where to start well in this video
we'll provide a stepbystep guide on how
people typically learn to love
themselves again and uncover which stage
most people fall into the Trap of
getting
stuck stage one
self-awareness self-love begins with
self-awareness it involves understanding
your feelings and recognizing your
patterns for instance maybe you notice
that you constantly put others first and
end up feeling drained or perhaps you
catch yourself procrastinating on things
that are actually good for you and
realize it's tied to fear of failure or
negative thoughts telling you that
you're not good enough self-awareness is
the stage where you learn to pause and
ask yourself
what am I
feeling what do I need right now to help
with understanding your emotions you can
start a reflection Journal at the end of
each day write down moments when you
felt drained or unhappy and why over
time you'll spot patterns that help you
understand yourself better always
remember that awareness is the first
step toward
change self-acceptance
once you're aware of your patterns the
next step is accepting yourself this
doesn't mean ignoring your flaws it
means embracing All of You The Good the
Bad and the messy without judgment
self-acceptance says I may not be where
I want to be yet but I'm still worthy of
love and respect maybe you struggle with
time management or getting things done
instead of calling yourself lazy
acknowledge it as a habit you can work
on not a reflection of your worth
replace self-criticism with affirmations
like I'm learning and growing every day
self-compassion self-compassion is about
treating yourself with kindness
especially during tough times think
about how you'd Comfort a best friend on
a hard day you wouldn't criticize them
right you'd offer support and
understanding according to Dr naad duuk
a registered psychotherapist
self-love starts with the same approach
it's about showing up for yourself
understanding your emotional needs and
facing challenges with kindness instead
of self-criticism or shame for example
if something doesn't go as planned
instead of saying I'm such a failure try
this didn't work out but I'm proud of
myself for trying I'll learn to do
better next time when you notice
negative selft talk pause and ask would
I say this to someone I care about if
not rephrase it with the same compassion
you'd show them before we go to stage
four here's a little something to
support you on your mental health
Journey bring saigh wherever you go as a
reminder of your own mental health we'll
be here for you whenever you need Link
in BIO stage four self- codling where
most people stop being kind to yourself
and treating yourself to the finest
things in life is great but what happens
when it goes too too far here's the
tricky part self- coddling can feel like
self-love but it's not self- coddling is
when you comfort yourselves in ways that
hold you back like making excuses to
avoid discomfort it prioritizes
short-term relief over long-term growth
keeping you stuck for example you plan
to exercise but H snooze telling
yourself I deserve rest while rest is
important constant using it as an excuse
prevents progress instead of skipping
your workout entirely say I'll do 10
minutes instead of a full session unlike
self-love which empowers you to grow
self- coddling keeps you in a cycle of
self-pity and stagnation it feels good
in the moment but limits your potential
in the long run remember self-love is
about doing what's best for your future
self not what's easy right now so how do
you do you prevent yourself from falling
into this trap this leads us to the next
Point stage five accountability and
growth this is where you realize that
indulging too much in comforting things
and staying in self-pity or a victim
mindset isn't getting you
anywhere the stage is about appreciating
your progress while staying committed to
the person you want to become it means
celebrating your strengths and small
wins like handling a tough conversation
better than you would have a year ago
that's real growth at the same time it's
about taking responsibility for the
areas you need to
improve if you've been avoiding a
difficult conversation with a loved one
accountability means addressing it
because it's essential for a healthier
relationship start small each week write
down three things you're proud of to
remind yourself of your progress then
set one daily goal that helps you grow
whether it's journaling making that call
or keeping a promise every small step
builds a self trust and brings you
closer to the person you want to be
stage six
self-discipline the final stage is
self-discipline the practical
application of
accountability this is where you
consistently show up for yourself even
when motivation Fades growth doesn't
happen without effort self-discipline
ensures you follow through on what
matters whether that's exercising
journaling or setting
boundaries and a good way to start is by
creating a simple routine of small steps
that align with your goals and building
consistency over time remember the
self-love journey is not
straightforward some days you're making
progress and on other days you slip back
into old habits and that's okay what
matters most most is you keep moving
forward even when it feels tough if you
find yourself stuck in the self-
coddling stage don't be discouraged
recognizing it is a step towards growth
treat yourself with kindness as you work
on self- appreciation and
self-discipline progress takes time and
every step no matter how small brings
you closer to the person you want to
become so what stage are you in in your
self-love Journey what's the most
